title: Data in Axes in Formats
text: goal dafr provide R bindings DataAxesFormats.jl Julia package, provides uniform generic interface accessing 1D 2D data arranged along set axes. much-needed generalization AnnData functionality. dafr package enables R users access Daf data using familiar R interfaces leveraging powerful implementation provided Julia package. package follows functional interface similar Julia implementation, limitations due limitations JuliaCall (see ).

title: Data in Axes in Formats
text: can install development version dafr GitHub : Note dafr requires Julia programming language DataAxesFormats.jl package installed. package uses JuliaCall interface Julia R.

title: Data in Axes in Formats
text: R package provides interface similar Julia package, functions mirror Julia API:
code: library(dafr) # Setup connection to Julia setup_daf() # Create a DAF object in memory daf <- memory_daf("example")  # Add axes add_axis(daf, "obs", c("cell1", "cell2", "cell3")) add_axis(daf, "var", c("gene1", "gene2"))  # Add vector data set_vector(daf, "obs", "score", c(0.1, 0.5, 0.9))  # Add matrix data mat <- matrix(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6), nrow = 3, ncol = 2) set_matrix(daf, "obs", "var", "counts", mat)  # Access data get_vector(daf, "obs", "score") #> cell1 cell2 cell3  #>   0.1   0.5   0.9 get_matrix(daf, "obs", "var", "counts") #>       gene1 gene2 #> cell1     1     4 #> cell2     2     5 #> cell3     3     6  # Get a dataframe view get_dataframe(daf, "obs", c("score")) #>       score #> cell1   0.1 #> cell2   0.5 #> cell3   0.9

title: Data in Axes in Formats
text: One powerful features dafr query language. can use queries access transform data flexibly. package provides convenient [ operator concise query syntax: query syntax follows simple pattern: / axis selects axis : property retrieves property % operation applies element-wise operation %> reduction applies reduction operation & property filters property = value, > value, etc. apply comparison operations See Julia documentation details query language.
code: # Create a sample dataset daf <- memory_daf("query_examples") add_axis(daf, "cell", c("A", "B", "C")) add_axis(daf, "gene", c("X", "Y", "Z")) set_vector(daf, "cell", "age", c(1, 5, 10)) set_vector(daf, "cell", "type", c("T", "B", "NK")) set_scalar(daf, "version", "1.0") set_matrix(daf, "cell", "gene", "counts", matrix(1:9, nrow = 3, ncol = 3))  # Basic queries using the [ operator # Get scalar values daf[": version"] # Get a scalar #> [1] "1.0"  # Access axes and properties daf["? axes"] # List all axes #> [1] "gene" "cell" daf["/ cell ?"] # List properties of the "cell" axis #> [1] "type" "age"  # Access vector data daf["/ cell : age"] # Get the "age" vector for all cells #>  A  B  C  #>  1  5 10  # Access matrix data daf["/ cell / gene : counts"] # Get the full counts matrix #>   X Y Z #> A 1 4 7 #> B 2 5 8 #> C 3 6 9  # Filter data daf["/ cell & age > 2 : type"] # Get types of cells with age > 2 #>    B    C  #>  "B" "NK"  # Transform data daf["/ cell : age % Abs"] # Get absolute values of ages #>  A  B  C  #>  1  5 10 daf["/ cell : age % Log base 2"] # Get log2 of ages #>        A        B        C  #> 0.000000 2.321928 3.321928  # Aggregations daf["/ cell : age %> Max"] # Get maximum age #> [1] 10 daf["/ cell : age %> Mean"] # Get mean age #> [1] 5.333333  # Complex operations can be built using the pipe operator or query functions # Get types of cells with age > 2 Axis("cell") |>     And("age") |>     IsGreater(2) |>     Lookup("type") |>     get_query(daf) #>    B    C  #>  "B" "NK"

title: Data in Axes in Formats
text: Due limitations JuliaCall, data copied R Julia function calls. means operations involving large matrices vectors incur memory overhead. large datasets, consider performing operations directly Julia side minimize data transfers. also means creating properties empty_dense_vector empty_sparse_vector supported R version.

title: Data in Axes in Formats
text: dafr package inherits key features DataAxesFormats.jl: Support -memory persistent data storage Thread-safe implementation using read/write locks Ability import export AnnData objects Support views adapters Chaining repositories efficient reuse data Flexible data model based axes, vectors, matrices, scalar data Explicit support grouped axes Simple query language common operations Control data layout support dense sparse matrices

what: dafr: Data in Axes in Formats — dafr-package
title: dafr: Data in Axes in Formats — dafr-package
text: R interface 'DataAxesFormats.jl' https://github.com/tanaylab/DataAxesFormats.jl, Julia package providing uniform interface accessing multi-dimensional data arranged along arbitrary axes. package generalizes extends 'AnnData'-like functionality, supporting 1D 2D data, multiple data modalities, efficient memory management. 'dafr' enables R users create, read, modify, analyze complex biological datasets single-cell data multiple modalities (RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, etc.). package implements efficient memory management strategies provides seamless interface R Julia handling large-scale biological data.

title: dafr 0.0.3
text: Added Count() counting non-zero elements, optional type parameter Added GeoMean() geometric mean reduction, optional type eps parameters Added Mode() common value reduction

title: dafr 0.0.3
text: Added escape_value() escaping special characters query strings Added unescape_value() reversing escape_value() Added query_requires_relayout() check query needs data relayout

title: dafr 0.0.3
text: Added get_empty_dense_vector() getting empty dense vectors -place filling Added get_empty_sparse_vector() getting empty sparse vectors -place filling Added get_empty_dense_matrix() getting empty dense matrices -place filling Added get_empty_sparse_matrix() getting empty sparse matrices -place filling Added filled_empty_sparse_vector() committing filled sparse vectors back Daf Added filled_empty_sparse_matrix() committing filled sparse matrices back Daf Exported get_frame() direct use

title: dafr 0.0.3
text: Added type parameter reduction operations (Abs, Sum, Mean, Median, Quantile, Var, VarN, Std, StdN, Min, Max, Count, Fraction, Round, Clamp, Log) Added eps parameter VarN, StdN, GeoMean Added type insist parameters copy_scalar() Added eltype, bestify, min_sparse_saving_fraction, insist parameters copy_vector() Added eltype, bestify, min_sparse_saving_fraction, insist parameters copy_matrix() Added relayout, bestify, min_sparse_saving_fraction parameters copy_tensor() Added X_eltype parameter daf_as_h5ad()

title: dafr 0.0.3
text: Added GitHub Actions workflows R CMD check, conda build, pkgdown site deployment Added conda recipe building distributing conda packages Fixed CI test execution properly install package running testthat tests

title: dafr 0.0.3
text: Added comprehensive tests new functions parameters New test files: test-operations.R, test-copies.R, test-data-writers.R, test-queries.R, test-anndata_format.R

title: dafr 0.0.2
text: Added create_contract() defining data contracts axes data specifications Added axis_contract(), scalar_contract(), vector_contract(), matrix_contract() specifying contract requirements Added tensor_contract() 3D tensor specifications Added verify_contract(), verify_input(), verify_output() validating Daf objects contracts Added contractor() creating contract-aware Daf wrappers Added contract_docs() generating markdown/text documentation contracts Added expectation types: RequiredInput, OptionalInput, GuaranteedOutput, OptionalOutput

title: dafr 0.0.2
text: Added group_names() generating unique deterministic names groups based members Added collect_group_members() converting group indices member lists Added compact_groups() compacting non-consecutive group indices 1..N

title: dafr 0.0.2
text: Added VIEW_ALL_AXES, VIEW_ALL_SCALARS, VIEW_ALL_VECTORS, VIEW_ALL_MATRICES, VIEW_ALL_DATA constants creating views complete data

title: dafr 0.0.2
text: Added is_axis_query() check query targets axes Added query_axis_name() extract axis name axis-queries
